channel.title: why are zombies so powerful?
channel.description: On difficult( in half life 1), zombies deal 40hp damage when they hit you with both claws. but garguantuas deal 30hp damage when they smack you. meaning that zombies can do more damage than garguantuas melee wise. I suppose they do so much damage because its almost impossible to get hit by them if you try to dodge,but the only real way you can ever be hit by a garg is on purpose, because to get with melee range means you have to pass threw their fire attack, which would deal quite a bit of damage. So because it so hard to get hit by them, they may as well remove the attack or make it somewhat more threatening in BMS, but that's just my opinion. but still, WHY do zombies do more melee damage than gargs? :hmph:

item.title: why are zombies so powerful?
item.dc:creator: brokenfridgehinge
item.description:
Neon Impulse:

i don’t want to sound dumb or anything, but how do you post loads of replies in the same box as you already have? i’m new to this forum thing:meh:

You mean multiquoting? You hit the “quote” button on the posts you want to reply to, then hit "add reply " down the bottom of the page.

Read full topic

item.title: why are zombies so powerful?
item.dc:creator: Neon_Impulse
item.description:
Dias:

I remember there was a nice big topic where people complained that the zombies were too powerful… “Zombies in serious need of an upgrade” or something along those lines.

They aren’t too powerful IMO, I was just saying.

Read full topic

item.title: why are zombies so powerful?
item.dc:creator: CooldKindJR
item.description:
Well if the zombies were to weak people would complain and to strong they’d complaine. So valve just left them in between same with the gargantuan.

Read full topic

item.title: why are zombies so powerful?
item.dc:creator: Master_Chef
item.description:
Why are you complaining about zombie swipes? At least they are mutated. Was I the only one startled by the strength of Marine kicks? Those took a huge chunk outta my health. (I DID play my first playthrough on hard, but it’s not THAT much of a difference.)

Read full topic

item.title: why are zombies so powerful?
item.dc:creator: Going_Postal
item.description:
Posting once, then instead of using the edit button you just post a second time.

Pretaining to the subject, if they hit you twice, wouldn’t that mean that one claw attack delt 20 points of damage?

Read full topic

item.description:

EDIT: and ninja’d?

item.title: why are zombies so powerful?
item.dc:creator: Neon_Impulse
item.description:
InterloperX:

I’ll toss this one up to gameplay balancing, given their lack of ranged attacks (or hell, attacks in general) it makes sense that they would deal out that much damage from a design perspective.

I have acknowledged that, I just found it hard to do so.

Mont_Blanc:

Give 30 damages more for the garg attack and problem solved. But since you got killed even before reaching a garg, it’s a bit useless.

Yeah, since its flame attack is alot more threatining, I don’t see why it even uses melee.

Read full topic

item.title: why are zombies so powerful?
item.dc:creator: Mont_Blanc
item.description:
Give 30 damages more for the garg attack and problem solved. But since you got killed even before reaching a garg, it’s a bit useless.

Read full topic

item.title: why are zombies so powerful?
item.dc:creator: Neon_Impulse
item.description:
MaxTheLimit:

Blunt force trauma < slashing damage I guess.
Maybe the HEV suit is able to better protect the wearer from being thumped, over being slashed to ribbons.

You have point, but still…an arm the size of yours and arm the size of you…what would logically do more damage? IMO, the garg. plus, wouldn’t it hands be REALLY hot because of the intense heat it stores within itself? I does think the outside is hot, because if it was the HEV suit would register fire damage and touching the garg would result in damage. but do to the fact he was wearing an HEV suit, I guess it might make sense for lacerations to be worse than blunt melee damage. plus, when you get hit by both hands from a zombie the suit says ‘MAJOR lacerations detected’ but when the garg hits you it just says ‘MINOR fracture detected’

Read full topic
